line_1: And bawls and drinks — but chiefly stares!
line_2: Pours forth unwitty jokes, and swears,

line_1: She faints within his icy grasp, yet stares,
line_2: And wonders why the Tyrant yet appears —

line_1: Turns colour, hems, and 'round him stares,
line_2: When the glad tidings reach'd his ears,
No pregnant mark of meaning bears,

line_1: And she, whose eye aghast with horror stares,
line_2: Whose meagre form a sister's likeness bears?

line_1: With the same wonder-gaping face he stares
line_2: On flat DUTCH dawbing, as on GUIDO'S airs;

line_1: By conscience stung he wildly stares,
line_2: And thus his guilty soul declares.
